oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Trinity United Methodist Church, 2001 May
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Trinity United Methodist Church located at 204 Trinity Lane in Nashville, Tennessee. The cornerstone indicates that the congregation was formed in 1857 with the original name of Trinity Methodist Church, while the church was built in 1904. The foundation is made of rough cut stone blocks. The exterior walls are brick. The roof is gabled with tar shingles. The windows include an oculus on the front facade and gothic arched stained glass windows on the side walls. The front doors are wooden. Special features include two small towers over the front doors. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Trinity United Methodist Church (Nashville, Tenn.); Trinity Methodist Church (Nashville, Tenn.)
